definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The State shall advocate that labourers practice individual insurance in form of saving account.
sentences.chinese: 国家提倡劳动者个人进行储蓄性保险。

sentences.english: I am a hardworker, have lots of energy and am a quick learner
sentences.chinese: 我是一个勤快的劳动者，学习能力强而且非常有活力。

sentences.english: The State advocates for individual workers to engage in savings insurance.
sentences.chinese: 国家提倡劳动者个人进行储蓄性保险。

sentences.english: Originally in foreign countries, as long as you are working, car and houses are for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 原来在国外，只要你是劳动者，汽车洋房人人有份。

sentences.english: Labourers who have worked for one successive year or more shall be entitled to an annual vacation with pay.
sentences.chinese: 劳动者连续工作一年以上的，享受带薪年休假。

sentences.english: Coordinate labour relations and gradually improve the living standards of the workers.
sentences.chinese: 协调劳动关系，逐步提高劳动者的生活水平。

sentences.english: We provided job training for 1 million urban and rural workers.
sentences.chinese: 全年组织100万城乡劳动者插手职业培训。

sentences.english: The final goal, for the vocational-technical education, is to realize the students employment.
sentences.chinese: 职业技术教育的最终目的，是实现劳动者的就业。

sentences.english: A laboring man needs bread and butter, and cash to pay the rent.
sentences.chinese: 劳动者需要面包和黄油，也要钱付房租。

sentences.english: The State shall advocate that individual labourers practise insurance in the form of saving deposits.
sentences.chinese: 国家提倡劳动者个人进行储蓄性保险。

sentences.english: China has a lot of slave labor , as well as very lax environmental laws.
sentences.chinese: 中国有很多奴隶劳动者，还有非常宽松的环境法规。

sentences.english: The economic compensations that are paid to a worker for any period of less than six months shall be one-half of his monthly salary.
sentences.chinese: 不满六个月的，向劳动者支付半个月工资的经济补偿。

sentences.english: The Industrial Revolution was characterized by specialization of individuals in their work tasks.
sentences.chinese: 工业革命的特点是个体劳动者劳动内容的细化。

sentences.english: It is a sonnet, too. It's a sort of song of a worker.
sentences.chinese: 也是一首十四行诗，是一个劳动者内心的歌。

definition: labor contract/contract between employer and employees governing wages and conditions
forced labor (as punishment in criminal case)
piece rate wage/remuneration based on one's output/opposite: time rate wage 計時工資|计时工资[ji4 shi2 gong1 zi1]
time rate wage/remuneration based on one's time and skill/opposite: piece rate wage 計件工資|计件工资[ji4 jian4 gong1 zi1]
industrial relations/relations between labor and capital
service (work done for money)/services (as in "goods and services")
